item.title: A Fresh Start
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: I’ve chosen to make a fresh start where I have more control over my content…

item.title: Giving Thanks
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: I’m up early this morning. My plan was to get up at 4:00 am, put the turkey in brine and then go back to bed for a few hours. But as my mind is prone to do, I began pondering all the things in my life I’m thankful for. So I thought I’d share some of them.

item.title: No to Everything Else
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: I took some time off work during the Thanksgiving holiday after grinding on a work project for a really long time. I’ve found myself at a point over the last six months where I just don’t feel effective and needed to figure out why.

item.title: My Internet Journey
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: I remember the first time I touched a computer. I was in my early twenties and worked as a customer service rep for the local water company, which is a fancy way of saying I played in the mud on an almost daily basis.

item.title: A Bicycle and Barbed Wire
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: Here’s another one of those childhood memories that left a scar; literally. This one is about the time I tried to stop my out of control bicycle using a barbed wire fence.

item.title: On the Fragility of Life
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: Events happen in our lives that make us do a full stop and give a long, hard look at how things are. This was one of those events that slapped me in the face so hard I’m still having a hard time grasping it.

item.title: A Better Applescript to Compress Files or Folders
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description:
A while ago, I created an AppleScript that allows you to compress files and folders by simply dropping them onto the applet. One of the readers left a comment asking for a way to achieve the following tasks:

  1. Select a folder from Finder.
  2. Store the folder name as “x”.
  3. Compress all files and sub-folders within the folder “x”, including their paths.
  4. Rename the resulting zip file as “x.zip”.
  5. Delete all the files that were used to create the zip file.

With the help of ChatGPT – and because I wanted to be lazy about it – I was able to come up with a solution to this challenge, which can be a great way to manage archives if that’s important to you.

item.title: Seeing the Forest for the Trees
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: No matter how well-intentioned we are, sometimes we allow things to sneak into our lives under the guise of it being something important.

item.title: Start Somewhere
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: Eventually you use up every excuse in your book for not doing the thing you keep saying you’re going to do. You’ve procrastinated yourself into a corner and realize it’s either time to just do it, or finally forget about it and move on.

item.title: Memorable Cigarettes
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: After nearly fifty years, I can still remember the first time I smoked a cigarette. It was early spring and my family lived on a farm in a semi-rural part of Colorado, a little north of Denver, at the foot of the Rocky Mountains.

item.title: Eliminating Digital Distractions
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: Life is so full of distractions. It seems everything is vying for our attention in one way or another these days, with most of it coming from our electronic gadgets.

item.title: Saying No
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: Saying no can be one of the hardest things to do.

item.title: Spin Cycle
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: I’ve been around long enough to know life moves in cycles.

item.title: Applescript to Compress Files and Folders
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: I had the need to select several folders at once in the Mac OS Finder and zip them up as individual archives. This AppleScript to compress files and folders was the solution I came up with.

item.title: Applescript to Add Files in the Mac Finder
item.author: hello@jimmitchell.dev (Jim Mitchell)
item.description: Today I had the need to add a bunch of named text files to a folder in the Finder on my Mac.
